title: Pahalgam attack: 'Killer had camera strapped to head, filmed husband's death'
content: Survivors of the Pahalgam tragedy recount the horror, stating terrorists recorded the massacre using bodycams. Sohini, widow of Bitan Adhikary, described how her husband was killed after admitting he was Hindu.

title: 'Not how you treat freedom fighters': SC pulls up Rahul over remarks on Savarkar
content: The Supreme Court has put a hold on the Allahabad High Court's decision to not dismiss summons against Rahul Gandhi in a defamation case related to his comments on Veer Savarkar. The apex court cautioned Gandhi about making disrespectful statements about freedom fighters, particularly Savarkar, who is highly respected in Maharashtra. The court, notably, referenced historical context, pointing out that Rahul Gandhi's grandmother, former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, had written a letter praising Savarkar.

title: 'Doing dirty work for US': Pak defence minister on support for terror groups
content: Pakistan's defence minister admitted to undertaking "dirty work" for the United States and the West for three decades, acknowledging it as a mistake that led to suffering. Following the Pahalgam attack, which resulted in 26 deaths, the government responded by suspending the Indus Waters Treaty, closing the Attari ICP, and reducing diplomatic staff.

title: Musk replies to JD Vance's family photos from Taj Mahal: One of the ...
content: US Vice President JD Vance, accompanied by his family, recently visited the Taj Mahal during a four-day trip to India. Vance shared photos on X, with Elon Musk commenting on the monument's beauty. The family's visit included a warm welcome from Uttar Pradesh's Chief Minister and stringent security measures along their route.

title: Top terrorist Altaf Lalli killed in encounter in J&K's Bandipora
content: Security forces eliminated a Lashkar-e-Taliba associate, Altaf Lalli, during an operation in Bandipora district, Jammu and Kashmir. Two police personnel sustained injuries in the exchange of fire and were hospitalized. The operation was initiated following intelligence about terrorist presence in the Kolnar Ajas area. This action follows a recent attack in Pahalgam where 26 people were killed.

title: In Pahalgam attack, one Adil drew blood, another shed it saving others
content: In the wake of the Pahalgam terror attack, two men named Adil Hussain are at the center of the story. Adil Hussain Thokar, a wanted LeT operative, is accused of orchestrating the assault after receiving training in Pakistan. Conversely, Syed Adil Hussain Shah, a pony handler, is being hailed as a hero for his bravery in attempting to stop the terrorists and protect tourists during the attack.

title: Kapil Sibal suggests PM form special session to discuss Pahalgam attack
content: Kapil Sibal proposed a special Parliament session to address the Pahalgam terror attack, emphasizing national unity against terrorism. He advocated for an unanimous resolution and international diplomatic efforts, including sending delegations to major countries to build pressure on Pakistan. Sibal also suggested leveraging India's market to influence nations trading with Pakistan and pushing for a UN Security Council resolution.

title: Meta lays off more employees in another round of job cuts
content: Meta is implementing layoffs in its Reality Labs division, impacting Oculus Studios and the VR fitness app Supernatural, acquired in 2023. This restructuring aims to improve efficiency and concentrate on future mixed reality experiences, although it will result in fewer new workout releases for Supernatural users.

title: Failed to anticipate Pahalgam terror attack: MHA, IB at all-party meet
content: Government officials admitted a security lapse regarding the Pahalgam terror attack. They stated that such an attack was not expected. An all-party meeting was held where opposition parties supported the government's actions against terrorism. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh highlighted the government's zero-tolerance policy. Home Minister Amit Shah and S Jaishankar briefed President Droupadi Murmu on the situation.

title: Fawad Khan's 'Abir Gulal' will not release in India following Pahalgam attack
content: The upcoming Bollywood debut of Pakistani actor Fawad Khan in 'Abir Gulal' has sparked controversy, intensified by the recent Pahalgam attack. Amidst national grief and outrage, the I&B Ministry has reportedly withheld the film's release in India. Khan condemned the 'horrific' attack in Pahalgam, where 26 lives were lost.

title: China’s snub to India’s advantage? Air India may buy 10 Boeing planes rejected by China
content: Air India is in talks with Boeing to acquire approximately 10 Boeing 737 MAX aircraft, initially intended for Chinese clients who declined delivery due to trade tensions with the U.S. This potential acquisition would bolster Air India Express's fleet and support the airline's expansion plans.

title: Cake delivery for Pak High Commission going viral after Pahalgam attack
content: Amidst outrage over the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 28 tourists, a video showing a man carrying a cake to the Pakistan High Commission has sparked controversy. Simultaneously, protests erupted in Delhi, with demonstrators demanding decisive action against Pakistan.

title: Bombay HC grants protection from arrest to Kunal Kamra in ‘traitor’ jibe case
content: The Bombay High Court has admitted Kunal Kamra's petition seeking to quash the FIR filed against him by an MLA over his comedy show. The court directed Mumbai police not to arrest Kamra during the petition's pendency but allowed the investigation to continue.

title: Why is stock market down today? BSE Sensex crashes over 1,000 points
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, BSE Sensex and Nifty50, crashed sharply after opening in green on Friday. While BSE Sensex dipped over 1,000 points, Nifty50 went below 24,000.

title: Houses of 2 terrorists involved in J&K terror attack brought down in blast
content: Authorities in Jammu and Kashmir demolished the house of Adil Thokar, a local terrorist implicated in the Pahalgam attack that resulted in 26 fatalities. Thokar, who received terror training in Pakistan, allegedly aided Pakistani terrorists in the recent assault.

title: Former ISRO chairman K. Kasturirangan no more
content: He chaired the drafting committee for the National Education Policy 2020, and headed the 12-member steering committee responsible for developing a new National Curriculum Framework

title: ED arrests former Rajasthan Minister Mahesh Joshi in JJM scam case
content: Former Congress Minister Mahesh Joshi arrested by ED in money laundering case related to Jal Jeevan Mission irregularities in Rajasthan

title: Pahalgam attack: Kapil Sibal urges PM Modi to call special session of Parliament
content: Kapil Sibal also suggested to the government to send out delegations of the ruling and Opposition MPs to various important countries so that diplomatic pressure can be created on Pakistan

title: Drug threat: Kerala Police to hold closed-door talks with Malayalam film industry stakeholders
content: Police have tasked District Anti-Narcotic Special Action Force units to covertly collect actionable intelligence on trafficking networks supplying narcotics to personalities in film industry

title: TVK plans grassroots push before Vijay’s State-wide tour: Aadhav Arjuna
content: Speaking to The Hindu, TVK’s election campaign management general secretary Aadhav Arjuna said the party has already formed eight-member committees across all 69,000 booths

title: Vice-Chancellors of T.N. State universities skip Governor Ravi’s meeting in Ooty
content: Governor R.N. Ravi alleges that Vice-Chancellors from State universities were warned by the State government not to attend the conference

title: Badlapur accused encounter: Bombay High Court slams State Govt for not registering FIR against cops despite order
content: The High Court had on April 7 said when a prima facie offence is disclosed, it is mandatory for the police to register a case

title: Two medical students of Tamil Nadu drown in Arabian Sea at Gokarna in coastal Karnataka
content: The deceased were part of a 23-member group of students who were on a tour of Dandeli-Gokarna and Murdeshwara in Uttara Kannada after completing their final examination

title: Savarkar defamation case: Supreme Court stays summons against Rahul Gandhi
content: “His statements would prompt other to make similar remarks against other freedom fighters,” Justice Dipankar Dutta said

title: Kunal Kamra shall not be arrested during pendency of petition: Bombay High Court
content: The Bench said that if the police wants to question the petitioner, then they will have to do it in Chennai with prior notice to the petitioner as the stand-up comedian currently lives in Tamil Nadu

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Army Chief Gen Upendra Dwivedi arrives in Kashmir to review situation
content: The Chief of Armed Staff (COAS) would carry out a comprehensive review of the security situation in Jammu and Kashmir, while top Army commanders will brief Army Chief about the security situation and steps taken in the aftermath of Phalgam attack, officials said.

title: Supreme Court rejects Punjab Govt’s plea challenging SAD leader Majithia’s bail in drugs case
content: The top court granted the anti-drug Special Task Force (STF) the liberty to seek cancellation of Mr. Majithia’s bail if he attempts to influence witnesses or the trial in the drugs case

title: Gold rate today: MCX gold futures open higher at Rs 96,120 per 10 grams
content: Gold futures saw a slight increase on Friday, starting at Rs 96,120/10 grams, while silver remained relatively flat. Mixed settlements were observed in both domestic and international markets yesterday. Gold prices rebounded above $3,300 per troy ounce due to increased U.S. unemployment claims and China's potential economic stimulus.

title: Medha Patkar arrested in defamation case after Delhi court issues non-bailable warrant
content: Delhi Police apprehended social activist Medha Patkar on Friday due to a defamation case filed by Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena in 2001. This action followed a Delhi court's issuance of a non-bailable warrant after observing Patkar's deliberate defiance of its sentencing order, specifically regarding probation bonds and a fine of Rs 1 lakh.

title: 'Hurt and angry': Neeraj breaks silence on inviting Nadeem for NC Classic
content: Javelin star Neeraj Chopra addressed criticism for inviting Pakistani athlete Arshad Nadeem to the Neeraj Chopra Classic in Bengaluru, scheduled for May 2025. He clarified the invitation preceded the Pahalgam attacks and condemned the ensuing hate directed at him and his family. The two-time Olympic medallist emphasised his patriotism and the event's aim to promote Indian sports, stating Nadeem's participation is now impossible.

title: Apple’s China exodus: All US iPhones to be made in India by 2025
content: Apple plans to shift iPhone assembly for the U.S. market to India by next year, driven by tariff threats and geopolitical risks. This move aims to produce over 60 million iPhones annually in India by 2026, doubling current output. The shift reflects a broader strategy to diversify away from China, with India's government providing incentives to boost electronics manufacturing.

title: Many tourists cancel Kashmir bookings, footfall may rise in Himachal Pradesh
content: Following the tragic terror attack in Kashmir's Pahalgam, Himachal Pradesh is bracing for a potential surge in tourism. With many travelers cancelling Kashmir trips, Himachal, like Uttarakhand, is expected to see increased footfall. While tourism stakeholders express sorrow for Kashmir, they acknowledge the likely shift.

title: IPL match today: CSK vs SRH - all you need to know
content: Chennai Super Kings will clash with Sunrisers Hyderabad in a vital IPL 2025 match. Both teams need a win to boost their playoff hopes. CSK aim to regain dominance at Chepauk while SRH seek batting consistency. The weather is expected to be hot at Chepauk with spinners slated to come into play. The head-to-head record between these two teams favours CSK.

title: IPL 2025: Virat Kohli breaks tie with Chris Gayle on T20 record
content: Virat Kohli's record-breaking 26th T20 half-century at Bengaluru's M. Chinnaswamy Stadium propelled Royal Challengers Bengaluru to their first home win of the IPL 2025 season against the Rajasthan Royals. Kohli surpassed Alex Hales for most fifties at a single venue and also overtook Chris Gayle in fifty-plus scores in T20 cricket.

title: Man accused of raping Dalit girl, 10, lynched in UP
content: In Hapur, a 28-year-old man, Shravan Kumar, accused of raping a 10-year-old Dalit girl, died in a Meerut hospital after being thrashed by villagers. The incident occurred on April 17 when Kumar allegedly lured the girl to an empty factory and assaulted her.

title: Kremlin 'ready to reach a deal' with US on Ukraine: Russia's Lavrov
content: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov stated Russia's readiness to negotiate with the US on Ukraine, emphasizing that certain elements require further refinement. He defended recent attacks on Ukraine, asserting that they targeted military objectives or civilian sites used by the military.

title: Pahalgam attacker part of earlier strikes, had Pakistan handlers
content: Investigators have linked Hashim Musa, a Pakistani attacker, to multiple strikes targeting non-locals in J&K, including the Pahalgam massacre. Security forces are offering a reward for Musa and two other Lashkar terrorists. Evidence suggests Pakistani masterminds guided these attacks, with local aides facilitating the operations. Authorities are actively investigating connections and vulnerabilities to prevent future incidents.

title: US spokesperson snubs Pak journalist over question on India-Pak border tensions
content: Amidst India-Pakistan border tensions, a US State Department spokesperson declined to comment, affirming previous statements by US leaders. This follows unwavering US support for India after the deadly Pahalgam terrorist attack, which claimed 26 lives. US President Trump and Vice President Vance conveyed condolences to PM Modi, while Secretary Rubio pledged US solidarity.

title: Asian stocks rise on Wall Street rally and trade optimism
content: Asian stocks surged, mirroring Wall Street's rally, fueled by Alphabet's strong earnings and renewed trade optimism under President Trump. Despite Nissan's profit warning, its shares rose on turnaround hopes. Positive sentiment was bolstered by potential US-South Korea trade understanding and anticipation of earlier Federal Reserve interest rate cuts, even amidst US-China trade talk uncertainties.

title: In '24-'25, 1,351 child marriages stopped in 416 districts: Report
content: A collective of voluntary organizations reports significant strides in combating child marriage in India. In 2024-25, over 1,351 child marriages were halted and over 1.2 lakh were prevented through legal and community interventions across 416 districts. West Bengal, Tamil Nadu, and Bihar recorded the highest number of FIRs in cases where marriages could not be stopped.

title: 'Can't expect to cooperate': Indian embassy in US on govt freezing Indus Water Treaty
content: The Indian embassy in Washington defended freezing the Indus Water Treaty with Pakistan, citing Pakistan's support for terrorism and civilian casualties. India asserts that cooperation is impossible while Pakistan sponsors cross-border terrorism, leading to the treaty being held in abeyance.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for April 25
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research suggests a positive outlook for the Indian stock market, highlighting Lemon Tree Hotels and Electrosteel Castings as top picks. Nifty is expected to reach 24,550 and potentially 24,850, while Bank Nifty aims for 56,800.

title: Man tries to save girlfriend from harassers, beaten to death
content: In New Town's Gouranganar, a 29-year-old man, Sanket Chatterjee, was fatally beaten after confronting three men harassing his live-in partner. The incident occurred in the early hours when the woman, having left home after an argument, was accosted by the trio. Despite her pleas and attempts to seek help from neighbors, the assault continued, leading to Sanket's death.

title: NOTA 'failed idea', never got a fraction of total votes, says EC
content: The Election Commission and the Centre informed the Supreme Court that the NOTA option has been largely ineffective, with winning candidates consistently securing significantly more votes. The court is considering whether a minimum vote percentage should be required for winning candidates, even in uncontested elections, a scenario that has become increasingly rare.

title: Massive anti-Naxal op targets 'core' stronghold
content: A massive anti-Naxal operation is underway in the Chhattisgarh-Telangana-Maharashtra tri-junction, targeting the CPI (Maoist) core area. Nearly 5,000 security personnel have reportedly surrounded 300 Naxalites, including top commanders like Hidma.

title: Madras High Court reverses discharge of T.N. Minister M.R.K. Panneerselvam from two disproportionate assets cases
content: Justice P. Velmurugan orders the conduct of trial against the Minister and his wife in both the cases pertaining to the check periods 1996-2001 and 2006-2011

title: Medha Patkar arrest: Delhi court orders release of activist hours after arrest in defamation case filed by L-G Saxena 24 years ago
content: A Delhi court on April 22 had dismissed a plea filed by Narmada Bachao Andolan leader Medha Patkar against her conviction in a 23-year-old defamation case filed by Delhi Lieutenant General V.K. Saxena.

title: Getting hate and abuse for inviting Pakistan's Nadeem to NC Classic, says Neeraj Chopra
content: “There are so many false narratives that certain sections of the media have created around me, but just because I do not speak up, it doesn’t make it true”, said Neeraj Chopra.

title: WBSSC office sends tentative list of ‘untainted’ candidates to DI office; many teachers left out
content: Multiple ‘untainted’ teachers’ complaint that they have been left out from the list; continue protests outside SSC office

title: Calcutta High Court seeks response from Bengal government over Deocha Pachami coal project
content: In the petition, it alleges the respondents, including State Government, have ‘reneged on their legal and contractual obligations’ and have ‘pursued a confounding trajectory of basalt mining in an area allotted for a coal block’

title: Kerala Waqf Board tells Supreme Court it was ‘completely ignored’ by JPC
content: Kerala State Waqf Board challenges Joint Parliamentary Committee’s neglect of Kerala in the top court, citing discrimination against stakeholders and beneficiaries

title: Mettur dam water to be released on June 12, Duraimurugan tells T.N. Assembly
content: Every year, the Mettur dam, considered the lifeline of Cauvey delta districts, is opened on June 12 for irrigation

title: We feel safe in Hyderabad: Kashmiris share after Pahalgam terror strike
content: While Kashmiri students in Punjab and Uttarakhand have alleged violence and harassment, in the campuses of Hyderabad’s universities, students are attending lectures, participating in events, and carrying on with their routines — without fear

title: From constable to officer: Uday Krishna Reddy shares his journey
content: Uday Krishna Reddy, who hails from a small village in A.P.’s Prakasham District, began his Civils preparation as a Group 2 Telugu medium student in 2015

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Houses of LeT terrorists demolished in Kashmir
content: The houses of Asif Sheikh at Tral, Pulwama district, and Adil Thoker in Bijbehara, Anantnag, were razed to the ground apparently using explosives, several media outlets reported in Srinagar.

title: DC visits Raichur fort to assess infrastructure needed to attract tourists
content: He directed officials to prepare a separate proposal to repair scattered stone structures, install safety railings, and ensure easy access for tourists

title: Bengal tourists back from Kashmir devastated by Pahalgam terrorist attack, feel sad for its people too
content: “There’s a heaviness in my chest thinking of the people I passed: the shopkeeper who smiled as he handed me almonds, the little boy chasing sheep near Betaab Valley — will they be okay?”, says Soma Roy who was in Pahalgam only a day before the shooting

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Hundreds gather in Kochi to mourn Keralite
content: Kerala Governor calls Ramachandran’s killing a ‘murder of humanity’ and an attack against ‘the meaning of India’

title: Pahalgam attack: UP bizman's wife treasures the shirt he last wore
content: Shubham Dwivedi, a Kanpur businessman, was killed by terrorists in Pahalgam, Kashmir, shortly after his wedding. His wife, Aishanya, recounted the horrific incident where a terrorist questioned their religion before shooting Shubham. During CM Yogi Adityanath's visit, Aishanya demanded retribution.

title: Harvard in talks to sell $ 1billion in private equity holdings: Report
content: Harvard University is reportedly negotiating the sale of approximately $1 billion in private equity fund interests, facilitated by Jefferies Financial Group, to Lexington Partners. This divestment aims to enhance liquidity amidst market instability and challenges in divesting companies. The move follows Harvard's recent announcement to secure $750 million in Wall Street financing as a precautionary measure.

title: Hazlewood delivers RCB’s first Chinnaswamy win in IPL 2025
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru secured a crucial victory against Rajasthan Royals, fueled by Virat Kohli's composed seventy and Josh Hazlewood's game-changing final overs. Kohli's innings anchored Bengaluru's innings, while Hazlewood's exceptional death bowling restricted Rajasthan's chase, ultimately sealing an eleven-run win for the home side. This victory propelled Bengaluru to third place, while Rajasthan's playoff aspirations suffered a setback.

title: 370, waqf: Pak lists triggers for 'cycle of violence'
content: Pakistan vehemently denied involvement in the Pahalgam attack, attributing it to alleged Indian oppression in J&K and persecution of Muslims. Citing the abrogation of Article 370 and the waqf bill, Pakistan claimed India's actions fueled violence and marginalized minorities.

title: Pak hold on Simla Agreement signals shift away from peaceful resolution of disputes
content: Pakistan has put the Simla Agreement on hold, citing India's alleged support for terrorism and disregard for international law. This agreement, signed in 1972, aimed to establish peaceful relations and resolve disputes bilaterally. Experts suggest this move could invalidate the Line of Control and remove restraints on both sides, potentially escalating tensions and impacting India's foreign policy.

title: Pakistan closes airspace for Indian carriers
content: Flights between North India and the West face disruptions as Pakistan closes its airspace, effective Thursday. Indian carriers will take longer routes, potentially adding up to two hours to North America flights and an hour to Europe flights. IndiGo has already cancelled some flights, while Air India and SpiceJet advise passengers to expect extended routes and check flight status.

title: ED detains BluSmart's Puneet Jaggi
content: Puneet Jaggi, a promoter of Gensol Engineering, has been detained by the Enforcement Directorate. He will be questioned about alleged FEMA violations. The probe focuses on potential fund diversions for foreign exchange acquisition. Searches occurred in Delhi, Gurgaon, and Ahmedabad. Anmol Jaggi, his brother, is expected to be summoned soon.

title: IAF carries out 'Aakraman' exercise with Rafales, Navy conducts drill
content: Amid heightened tensions with Pakistan, Indian armed forces are on high alert. Army chief General Upendra Dwivedi is set to visit J&K to review operational readiness along the LoC and counter-terror operations. Simultaneously, the Indian Navy conducted missile tests in the Arabian Sea, mirroring Pakistan's naval exercises, while the Air Force enhances combat skills through 'Aakraman' exercises.

title: 'Kesari 2' box office day 7: Akshay Kumar starrer inches towards Rs 50cr
content: 'Kesari 2' has now completed 7 days at the box office but the film has not yet crossed the Rs 50 crore mark. It has seen a dip in the numbers during the weekdays but Emraan Hashmi's 'Ground Zero' which releases today may further give it competition.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Don't worry, stay strong, techie told wife in last words
content: In a tragic incident, Bengaluru techie Bharath Bhushan was killed in a terrorist attack, as narrated by his wife Sujatha. Before being shot, Bharath comforted his family, urging them to stay strong. The terrorist questioned their happiness amidst suffering, then fatally shot Bharath after learning his name.

title: World Bank not informed of India’s decision on Indus Waters Treaty
content: India’s decision means that it will stop its periodic communication with Pakistan on sharing hydrological data on the Indus rivers, or inform them of infrastructural work on hydro-electric projects in the Western Rivers

title: Appear before police: Telangana HC tells shaadi.com employees in matrimonial cheating case involving fake profile
content: Man who posted fake profiles on matrimony website was accused of duping nearly 20 women with this modus operandi

title: Shaadi.com under fire after ₹11 lakh matrimonial scam; Hyderabad police expose platform’s lapses
content: Senior officials at Shaadi.com, including director Anupam Mittal, team lead Satish, and  others named for enabling the transmission of false data and taking no action despite receiving complaints

title: Heart of Kashmir | Review of The World With Its Mouth Open by Zahid Rafiq
content: The journalist-turned-author trains his lens away from the narrative of conflict in his book of short stories

title: Mental health services for the injured and their families who have returned from Pahalgam
content: Maharashtra Government provides mental health support for Pahalgam accident victims and families at Mumbai civic-run hospitals

title: Sasthra Vedhi conference meet begins in Thiruvananthapuram
content: Former ISRO chairman S. Somanath to speak at Sasthra Vedhi conference, with various science-related activities planned

title: Encounter breaks out in Bandipora in Jammu and Kashmir
content: Security forces conduct search operation in Bandipora district, encounter with ultras ensues, no casualties reported

title: The chaos of Karnataka’s caste survey
content: The State’s 10-year-old survey coming up for discussion before the Cabinet has invited a slew of criticism — from the politically dominant communities questioning the veracity of their enumeration to experts examining the recommendations, including one for reclassification of certain communities

title: All bark no bite: The toothless critiques of Hollywood’s anti-capitalist media
content: Society’s collective thirst for catharsis is answered by Hollywood with superficial satires that shrink from addressing larger socio-economic structures that divide the haves from the have-nots; it seems that the cinema-going audience is itself the object of this satire

title: Price of belonging: bias, scrutiny and skyrocketing rents
content: Hyderabad’s rental market has transformed into a hub with strict tenant vetting, screening on work hours, marital status, caste, and cooking habits, all against a backdrop of eye-watering rents. Naveen Kumar unpacks the high stakes and hidden hurdles behind every lease

title: Google’s expanding AI ambitions in India clash with global antitrust scrutiny
content: Google is aggressively integrating generative AI into its advertising ecosystem in India as the company faces mounting pressure in the U.S. over its dominance in the online advertising sector

title: Madras High Court finds grave irregularities in selection of Sub-Inspectors of Police in Tamil Nadu
content: Orders redrawal of the selection list under the supervision of former Jammu and Kashmir High Court Chief Justice Paul Vasanthakumar

title: Beyond the bill: how food business is dealing with price rise
content: Bengaluru may be the at the forefront of the culinary scene in India. But a peak behind the curtain, and the reality is starkly different. The industry is fraught with obstacles of managing staff, increasing tariffs, overhead costs and the rising price of produce. How do businesses cope? Anagha Maareesha finds out.

title: ‘Scarcity of brides’ hits Old Mysore region
content: Finding brides for young farmers has become a social challenge in several parts of Karnataka. Farmers’ leaders cite non-remunerative agriculture and the skewed sex ratio as key reasons for this issue

title: Pahalgam attack LIVE: Army Chief in Kashmir to review security situation, Rahul Gandhi in Srinagar to meet those injured
content: United Nations chief Antonio Guterres urges India, Pakistan to exercise ‘maximum restraint’; spokesperson says “we were very clear in our condemnation of the terror attack”

title: Rooted in tech, rising through inclusion, reaching for equity in Andhra Pradesh
content: The Andhra Pradesh government is leveraging technology and modern tools, such as Digitally Accessible Pedagogy, to integrate children with special needs into the mainstream education system under the ‘Project 2027’ initiative, launched by the Samagra Shiksha programme of the Ministry of Education. Parents, tutors and mentors opine that the results of the initiatives have proven to be transformational

title: Kochi Water Metro sails into third year with  patronage of 4 million commuters
content: The first-of-its-kind water transport system in India aims to introduce 78 ferries in the Greater Kochi area in a phased manner; KMRL submits feasibility study to implement Water Metro in Mumbai

title: In Maharashtra, Pahalgam incident sparks a ‘credit battle’ in Mahayuti
content: CM Fadnavis should have called a Cabinet meeting and allocated responsibilities, instead of displaying one-upmanship, says Congress

title: BSF scales down Beating Retreat ceremony; handshake with Pak. soldiers suspended
content: These steps, it said, reflected “India’s serious concern over cross-border hostilities and reaffirms that peace and provocation cannot coexist

title: MiTran Global to host ‘Imparting Positivity’ camp for teens
content: Interactive two-day online programme to focus on academic clarity and emotional well-being for students aged 11 to 17

title: Kerala CM’s daughter Veena diverted funds from CMRL to EICIPL to repay loan: SFIO
content: The agency had reported that CMRL had made a monthly payment of ₹5 lakh to Ms. Veena and ₹3 lakh to her firm, Exalogic, as retainer for IT and marketing consultancy services

title: Pahalgam attack sparks protest outside Pakistan High Commission in Delhi
content: Capital unites in grief and anger, outraged citizens demand action against neighbouring country for ‘backing terrorism’, leading to detentions and solidarity marches

title: 2008 Mumbai attack: Delhi court junks Tahawwur Rana plea to talk to kin
content: The NIA opposed the application, arguing he could share crucial information if allowed to speak with his family members

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Gloom gives way to rage as kin of victims raise poor security
content: There were no security personnel at the time of attack, and nearest security camps are a few kilometres away; officials say government’s policy is to keep Army away from tourist destinations; no communication signal could be traced, says Home Minister Amit Shah

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Karnataka government brings back 175 tourists from Kashmir
content: Minister Santosh Lad informs that 20 to 22 tourists are in Kashmir, and were expected to return shortly on commercial flights

title: Tamil Nadu is currently home to over 10,800 start-ups, says T.M. Anbarasan
content: Delivering the valedictory address at The Hindu Tamil Nadu Startup Summit-25, he says the construction of a regional innovation centre has been planned in Thoothukudi in this fiscal, and regional innovation centres have been set up in Erode, Tirunelveli, Hosur, Salem, Cuddalore, Thanjavur, and Coimbatore

title: Startup Summit-25 | Healthcare industry is in need of technology intervention at all levels: experts
content: Panelists recall from their experience the benefit that have accrued to patients and medical professionals

title: To have and to hold | Single people over 60 in Maharashtra choose companionship
content: Happy Seniors program in Pune helps single seniors find companionship through marriage or live-in relationships after 60. Purnima Sah explores the emotional and legal complexities of such relationships and how senior couples face them together

title: Tears, heartbreak as bodies of Bengal tourists reach home
content: Leaders from both Trinamool Congress and BJP have demanded compensation to the family of the deceased tourists

title: Pahalgam terror attack: India to explore ‘never considered’ options on Indus Waters Treaty
content: These may include withdrawing from talks on evolving a new ‘Dispute Resolution Mechanism,’ change the design of its hydropower electric projects to allow it to store greater quantities of water

title: Former PM H.D. Deve Gowda opposes land acquisition for Bidadi township project
content: Mr. Gowda said that agricultural land was essential for the livelihood of farmers who are dependent on it for dairy farming, sericulture, horticulture, and cultivation

title: LIC to expedite claim settlements of Pahalgam terror victims
content: For assistance, the claimants may contact the nearest LIC branch, division, or customer zones. They may also call LIC call centre at 022 68276827, the company said

title: More than a smile: why orthodontic care for students is imperative
content: Studies suggest that 20%-30% of schoolchildren may require orthodontic attention. But treatment is often delayed because of cost, lack of awareness, or stigma. The Virudhunagar model shows the way forward to deal with the problem at the district level

title: Uttarakhand to make 1 lakh people learn Sanskrit to make it ‘common’ spoken language
content: CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said that the project for Sanskrit learning for common people will be implemented in a phased manner and government will come up with schemes to ensure jobs for youth learning Sanskrit.

title: Brace for longer flights to the Gulf, Europe and the U.S. as Pakistan shuts its airspace
content: Indian airlines are bracing for significantly longer flight times – potentially adding up to 90 minutes for U.S. routes – and probable fare increases

title: Elderly man trampled to death by elephant in Wayanad
content: The victim was identified as Arumukhan, a Tamil Nadu native who was living in Poolakkolli tribal hamlet

title: Andhra Pradesh Govt. decides to initiate disciplinary action against IPS officer P.V. Sunil Kumar
content: Sunil Kumar is facing charges related to misbehaviour and misconduct regarding his foreign trips, as per a G.O. issued by Chief Secretary

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Tourists taken to meadow without police permission, government informs all-party meeting
content: Home Minister Amit Shah, according to sources, said that the response from security officials was delayed because of the terrain

title: State mourning to conclude on Saturday with Pope Francis’ funeral
content: The National Flag will be flown at half-mast in all buildings, and there will be no official entertainment scheduled for the day

title: Giants trade up for QB Dart after drafting Carter
content: The Giants selected Penn State star Abdul Carter and QB Jaxson Dart in the first round of the NFL draft.

title: Jags trade up for Hunter, who can 'alter the sport'
content: The Jacksonville Jaguars traded up to acquire the No. 2 pick Thursday and selected wide receiver and cornerback Travis Hunter.

title: Morant on crutches, status uncertain after fall
content: Grizzlies superstar Ja Morant sustained a hip injury in a hard fall during Thursday's Game 3 loss to the Thunder.

title: Pistons, Knicks miffed by officiating in wild finish
content: Both clubs were unhappy after a pair of odd plays that were or weren't whistled in the closing seconds of New York's win in Detroit on Thursday night.

title: Steelers pass on QBs: 'We wanted' DT Harmon
content: The Steelers fielded several offers for the No. 21 pick, but said they never considered trading it away when they had the chance to take Oregon defensive tackle Derrick Harmon on Thursday night.

title: Packers end 1st-round WR drought, pick Golden
content: Much to the delight of the Packers-heavy crowd jammed between Lambeau Field and the draft stage, Green Bay selected receiver Matthew Golden of Texas with the 23rd pick in the draft.

title: Raiders GM honors son's preference, picks Jeanty
content: The Raiders selected Boise State running back Ashton Jeanty with the No. 6 pick in the NFL draft Thursday night.

title: Ian Darke's Premier League flops of the season: Højlund, Foden, more
content: It's not been the easiest season for Man United or Rasmus Højlund, but who else has notably underperformed in the Premier League this season? Ian Darke makes his picks.

title: Bundesliga's race for Europe: Can Dortmund come back to reach UCL?
content: The Bundesliga table is tight near the top, with 11 teams possessing real and achievable European aspirations.

title: Sources: Brazil in talks again with Ancelotti's camp
content: Carlo Ancelotti is once again the front-runner for Brazil's vacant coaching job, sources told ESPN Brasil.

title: Vardy to leave Leicester: 'Our greatest-ever player'
content: Jamie Vardy will leave Leicester City at the end of the season, the Premier League club confirmed on Wednesday.

title: Szczesny on smoking: Don't follow my example
content: Barcelona goalkeeper Wojciech Szczesny has told ESPN he has lost his battle with smoking and urged others not to follow his lead.

title: Source: Bayern's Müller rejects Cincinnati offer
content: Bayern Munich midfielder/forward Thomas Müller has rejected a contract offer from FC Cincinnati, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Ronaldo-owned Valladolid relegated from LaLiga
content: Real Valladolid, the team owned by former Brazil striker Ronaldo, was relegated from LaLiga after a 5-1 loss at Real Betis on Thursday.

title: Why Were There No Soldiers At Pahalgam, Asks Opposition. Centre Answers
content: The Opposition raised pointed questions at the Centre during the all-party meeting on Thursday evening over the Pahalgam terror attack that left 26 civilians dead.

title: Pahalgam Terror Attack Live Updates: J&K Lt Governor Meets Army Chief, Says Every Perpetrator Must Be Hunted
content: Pahalgam Terror Attack Live Updates: Prime Minister Narendra Modi vowed to hunt down the gunmen responsible for killing 26 civilians at Baisaran.

title: South Africa's 'Cradle Of Humankind' Caves Reopen After Flooding
content: Visitors marvelled at the weathered limestone rocks hanging from the ceiling of South Africa's Sterkfontein caves, millions of years old.

title: Donald Trump To Run For Third Term? 'Trump 2028' Hats, T Shirts Go On Sale
content: The sale came shortly after Donald Trump,who returned to power in January, said he was "not joking" about the prospect of seeking a third term.

title: Nepal's Long Road To Quake Resilience
content: Nepal 2015 earthquake was a wake up call for a country that is situated on a dangerous geological faultline, where the Indian tectonic plate collides with the Eurasian plate to form the Himalayas.

title: In A First, Supreme Court Stands For Victims Of Pahalgam Attack
content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday condemned the Pahalgam terrorist attack and observed a moment of silence in remembrance of the victims.

title: Lucknow Shahi Imam Backs Centre's Countermeasures Against Pakistan
content: Maulana Qari Syed Fazlul Mannan Rahmani, Shahi Imam of Teele Wali Masjid in Lucknow, condemned the Pahalgam terror attack and expressed his support for the government's decision to take action against Pakistan for spreading terrorism.

title: Fossil Teeth Reveal Secrets Of Extinct Giant Kangaroo's Lifestyle
content: Large kangaroos today roam long distances across the outback, often surviving droughts by moving in mobs to find new food when pickings are slim.

title: Pahalgam Attack Witness On How They Escaped, But Friend, 70, Was Killed
content: Mr Mouli, who turned 70 on April 18, had encouraged his friends to visit the Baisaran meadow, calling it a "once in a lifetime opportunity".

title: Harvard In Talks To Sell $1 Billion Of Private Equity Stakes Amid Feud With Trump: Report
content: Harvard has allocated almost 40% of its $53 billion endowment to private equity, according to an annual report for the year ended in June.

title: Chhattisgarh Teen Kills Father Over Drunkenness, Fights With Mother
content: A 15-year-old girl allegedly attacked and killed her father with an axe over his frequent drunkenness and quarrels with her mother in Chhattisgarh's Jashpur district.

title: Heatwave Alert For Delhi, Maximum Temperature To Settle At 42 Degrees
content: The city recorded a minimum temperature of 21.6 degrees Celsius on Friday, with the weather department forecasting a heatwave for the day.

title: "Surrender Or Perish": 10,000 Soldiers Encircle Maoists In Biggest-Ever Op
content: On the jagged hills where three states meet - Chhattisgarh, Telangana, and Maharashtra - war drums are echoing once again.

title: Pakistanis Start Arriving At Wagah Border Before Deadline To Leave India
content: Pakistani nationals have started arriving at the Wagah-Attari border in Amritsar ahead of their deadline to leave India in the wake of the Pahalgam terror attack that left 26 civilians dead in a tourist hotspot in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Pahalgam Victims Treated At Dispensary, Locals Say Hospital 40 km Away
content: As bleeding tourists were evacuated after the Pahalgam terror attack, locals claim a hospital in the vicinity could have saved lives.

title: 2 Men Arrested For Allegedly Raping, Blackmailing College Students In Bhopal
content: Two men befriended students from a private engineering college in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal then allegedly raped and blackmailed them with private videos, later forcing them to convert and marry.

title: Queen Camilla's Sister Annabel Elliot Says She "Finds It Impossible" To Curtsy To Her
content: Annabel Elliot, the younger sister of Queen Camilla, has admitted she "finds it impossible" to curtsy to her sister, despite Camilla being part of the royal family for two decades.

title: Sensex Falls Over 1,000 Points Amid Tensions Over Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: Indian equity markets are trading in the red as tensions soar between India and Pakistan over the Pahalgam terror attack in Kashmir. Sensex, the 30-share BSE benchmark, has crashed over 1,000 points and is now trading below the 79,000-mark.

title: Women's-specific cleats to be used in USL league
content: The players union for the USL Super League has partnered with women's soccer footwear company IDA Sports to provide its cleats to all the league's athletes.

title: Sources: Arsenal confident in Zubimendi deal
content: Arsenal are confident they will make Real Sociedad midfielder Martín Zubimendi their first major summer signing despite interest from Real Madrid, sources have told ESPN.

title: Mavs coach Kidd joins Everton ownership group
content: Dallas Mavericks head coach Jason Kidd has joined the ownership group of Everton, the Premier League club announced Thursday.

title: Thompson leads USWNT in ranking, but other internationals dominate

title: Donald Trump Orders Probe Into Democrats' Fundraising Platform ActBlue
content: the republican leader signed a memorandum instructing the justice department to probe the main fundraising platform used by Democrats . he said he wanted the probe to look at the use of "fundraising platforms to make 'straw' or 'dummy' contributions and to make foreign contributions to US political candidates and committees .

title: Western Conference playoffs: Thunder on verge of completing sweep vs. Grizzlies
content: the 2024-25 NBA playoffs are in full swing, and our insiders have you covered for every game in the march to the finals . on friday, the no. 1 seed Oklahoma City Thunder completed a comeback to go up 3-0 in the series against the No. 8 seed Memphis Grizzlies . the first playoff game at the Intuit Dome in Inglewood saw the no no. 4 seed Denver Nuggets take a 2-1 lead after the teams split the first two matchup

title: NBA playoff odds: Celtics win again, on collision course with West favorite Thunder
content: the top-seeded Oklahoma City Thunder entered the playoffs as favorites to win the NBA championship . the Los Angeles Lakers , Golden State Warriors , LA Clippers , Denver Nuggets and Minnesota Timberwolves all have better odds . they have traded series-favorite status with their Game 1 and Game 2 wins .

title: Why Jags went all-in on Travis Hunter at the NFL draft: Will he play both sides of the ball?
content: the Jacksonville Jaguars knew early in the pre-NFL draft process that they wanted Travis Hunter . but he didn't think they'd be able to pull it off, knowing he'd have to trade up from no. 5 overall . he called the Cleveland Browns several weeks ago to see if they could work out a deal .

title: Power Rankings: There's a new No. 1 ... again
content: just 2.5 games separate four teams -- three of which have winning percentages above .600 -- in the NL West . in the american league, while the Yankees are playing as well as projected, a number of teams are hovering around .500, the Orioles are scuffling and the Twins have the second-worst record in the league .

title: 'All I needed was a chance': How Cam Ward went from zero-star recruit to No. 1 pick

title: Why Nico Iamaleava soured on Tennessee and ended up at UCLA
content: Iamaleava was set to make around $2.4 million at Tennessee this year, sources say . sources close to the quarterback deny they were seeking $4 million . he needed to take a "mental break" after the Vols' 42-17 loss to the college football world .
